text: Oracle of Judgment on Cush
Ah! land \add of the\add* whirring of wings,
which \add is\add* beyond the rivers of Cush,
that sends messengers by the sea
and in vessels of papyrus on \add the\add* surface of \add the\add* waters!
Go, swift messengers, to a ⸤tall⸥\f + \fr 18:2 \ft Literally “stretched out” \f* and ⸤smooth⸥\f + \fr 18:2 \ft Literally “peeled,” “wiped clean,” or “hairless” \f* nation,
to a people feared ⸤near and far⸥,\f + \fr 18:2 \ft Literally “from this and beyond” \f*
a ⸤mighty, mighty⸥\f + \fr 18:2 \ft Perhaps this is a gibberish phrase in Hebrew, \fqa qaw-qaw \ft  \f* and trampling\f + \fr 18:2 \ft Meaning uncertain \f* nation,
whose land rivers divide.
All \add you\add* inhabitants of \add the\add* world
and dwellers of \add the\add* earth,
⸤when a signal is raised on the⸥\f + \fr 18:3 \ft Literally “as a raising of a signal” \f* mountains, you must look,
and ⸤when a trumpet is blown⸥,\f + \fr 18:3 \ft Literally “as a blowing of a trumpet” \f* you must listen!
For Yahweh said this to me:
“I will be quiet,
and I will look from my dwelling place
like ⸤clear heat because of light⸥,\f + \fr 18:4 \ft The meaning of this phrase is uncertain; perhaps the “light” is sunlight \f*
like a cloud of dew in \add the\add* heat of harvest.”
For before \add the\add* harvest, ⸤when the blossom is complete⸥\f + \fr 18:5 \ft Literally “as a completion of a blossom” \f*
and a blossom becomes ripening fruit,
and one cuts off the shoots with pruning hooks,
and one removes, tears away the tendrils.
They shall ⸤all be left⸥\f + \fr 18:6 \ft Literally “be left together” \f* for birds\f + \fr 18:6 \ft Hebrew “bird” \f* of prey of \add the\add* mountains
and for the animals\f + \fr 18:6 \ft Hebrew “animal” \f* of the earth.
And the birds\f + \fr 18:6 \ft Hebrew “bird” \f* of prey will pass the summer on it,
and every animal of the earth will winter on it.
At that time, a gift\f + \fr 18:7 \ft Perhaps tribute is meant \f* will be brought to Yahweh of hosts
\add from\add* a ⸤tall⸥\f + \fr 18:7 \ft Literally “stretched out” \f* and ⸤smooth⸥\f + \fr 18:7 \ft Literally “peeled,” “wiped clean,” or “hairless” \f* people,
and from a people feared near and far,
a mighty, mighty and trampling nation,
whose land \add the\add* rivers divide,
to the place of the name of Yahweh of hosts,
the mountain of Zion.
